intro: Myrsine tetrandra, commonly known as the four-thread myrsine, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Myrsinaceae and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are usually arranged alternately along the stems. The plant produces small, white or pale green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. Myrsine tetrandra is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
